verses.verse: A prayer <S%H8605><s%> of Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> upon Shigionoth <S%H7692><s%>.

O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, I have heard <S%H8085><s%> your speech <S%H8088><s%>, and was afraid <S%H3372><s%>: O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, revive <S%H2421><s%> your work <S%H6467><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years <S%H8141><s%>, in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years <S%H8141><s%> make known <S%H3045><s%>; in wrath <S%H7267><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> mercy <S%H7355><s%>.

God <S%H433><s%> came <S%H935><s%> from Teman <S%H8487><s%>, and the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> from mountain <S%H2022><s%> Paran <S%H6290><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>. His glory <S%H1935><s%> covered <S%H3680><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%>, and the earth <S%H776><s%> was full <S%H4390><s%> of his praise <S%H8416><s%>.
And his brightness <S%H5051><s%> was as the light <S%H216><s%>; he had horns <S%H7161><s%> coming out of his hand <S%H3027><s%>: and there was the hiding <S%H2253><s%> of his power <S%H5797><s%>.
Before <S%H6440><s%> him went <S%H3212><s%> the pestilence <S%H1698><s%>, and burning coals <S%H7565><s%> went forth <S%H3318><s%> at his feet <S%H7272><s%>.

He stood <S%H5975><s%>, and measured <S%H4128><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%>: he looked <S%H7200><s%>, and drove asunder <S%H5425><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%>; and the everlasting <S%H5703><s%> mountains <S%H2042><s%> were scattered <S%H6327><s%>, the perpetual <S%H5769><s%> hills <S%H1389><s%> did bow <S%H7817><s%>: his ways <S%H1979><s%> are everlasting <S%H5769><s%>.

I saw <S%H7200><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of Cushan <S%H3572><s%> in affliction <S%H205><s%>: and the curtains <S%H3407><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> did tremble <S%H7264><s%>.

Was the Lord <S%H3068><s%> displeased <S%H2734><s%> against the rivers <S%H5104><s%>? was your anger <S%H639><s%> against the rivers <S%H5104><s%>? was your wrath <S%H5678><s%> against the sea <S%H3220><s%>, that you did ride <S%H7392><s%> upon your horses <S%H5483><s%> and your chariots <S%H4818><s%> of salvation <S%H3444><s%>?

Your bow <S%H7198><s%> was made quite <S%H6181><s%> naked <S%H5783><s%>, according to the oaths <S%H7621><s%> of the tribes <S%H4294><s%>, even your word <S%H562><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>. You did cleave <S%H1234><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> with rivers <S%H5104><s%>.

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> you <S%H2342><s%>, and they trembled: the overflowing <S%H2230><s%> of the water <S%H4325><s%> passed by <S%H5674><s%>: the deep <S%H8415><s%> uttered <S%H5414><s%> his voice <S%H6963><s%>, and lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> on high <S%H7315><s%>.

The sun <S%H8121><s%> and moon <S%H3394><s%> stood still <S%H5975><s%> in their habitation <S%H2073><s%>: at the light <S%H216><s%> of your arrows <S%H2671><s%> they went <S%H1980><s%>, and at the shining <S%H5051><s%> of your glittering <S%H1300><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%>.
You did march through <S%H6805><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> in indignation <S%H2195><s%>, you did thresh <S%H1758><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%> in anger <S%H639><s%>.

You went forth <S%H3318><s%> for the salvation <S%H3468><s%> of your people <S%H5971><s%>, even for salvation <S%H3468><s%> with your anointed <S%H4899><s%>; you wounded <S%H4272><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%> out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, by discovering <S%H6168><s%> the foundation <S%H3247><s%> unto the neck <S%H6677><s%>. Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

You did strike through <S%H5344><s%> with his poles <S%H4294><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%> of his villages <S%H6518><s%>: they came out as a whirlwind <S%H5590><s%> to scatter <S%H6327><s%> me <S%H5951><s%>: their rejoicing was as to devour <S%H398><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> secretly <S%H4565><s%>.
You did walk <S%H1869><s%> through the sea <S%H3220><s%> with your horses <S%H5483><s%>, through the heap <S%H2563><s%> of great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>.

When I heard <S%H8085><s%>, my belly <S%H990><s%> trembled <S%H7264><s%>; my lips <S%H8193><s%> quivered <S%H6750><s%> at the voice <S%H6963><s%>: rottenness <S%H7538><s%> entered <S%H935><s%> into my bones <S%H6106><s%>, and I trembled <S%H7264><s%> in myself <S%H5117><s%>, that I might rest in the day <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>: when he comes up <S%H5927><s%> unto the people <S%H5971><s%>, he will invade them with his troops <S%H1464><s%>.

Although the fig tree <S%H8384><s%> shall not blossom <S%H6524><s%>, neither shall fruit <S%H2981><s%> be in the vines <S%H1612><s%>; the labor <S%H4639><s%> of the olive <S%H2132><s%> shall fail <S%H3584><s%>, and the fields <S%H7709><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> no food <S%H400><s%>; the flock <S%H6629><s%> shall be cut off <S%H1504><s%> from the fold <S%H4356><s%>, and there shall be no herd <S%H1241><s%> in the stalls <S%H7517><s%>:
Yet I will rejoice <S%H5937><s%> in the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, I will joy <S%H1523><s%> in the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation <S%H3468><s%>.

The Lord <S%H3069><s%> God <S%H136><s%> is my strength <S%H2428><s%>, and he will make <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> like hinds <S%H355><s%>' feet <S%H1869><s%>, and he will make me to walk upon my high places <S%H1116><s%>. To the chief singer <S%H5329><s%> on my stringed instruments <S%H5058><s%>.
